basics.name: Clay Miller
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: I build the Internet. My ideal workplace lets me take ownership in my work, learn bleeding-edge technologies, help people connect and grow, and build things that endure. Diversity, accessibility and empathy are very important to me. I’ll continue developing—learning new skills while honing existing ones—and I’ll share everything I learn. He/Him.

work.summary: Xamarin provides development tools to build and test native mobile apps, including Xamarin Platform, Xamarin Test Cloud, & Xamarin Insights.
highlights: Wrote 190,000 lines of production code on xamarin.com.
Converted an additional 20,000 lines of Less to Sass.
Designed, built and maintained a conference website used daily by 1200 attendees.
Created a party registration form which attracted 1400 attendees.
Performed A/B tests on product landing pages resulting in a 12% increase in conversions.
Managed a live video feed viewed in 90 countries.
Presented sortable and filterable information for 320 consulting partners.
Shipped 8 pages in the Visual Studio IDE.
Increased Qualys SSL Labs score from a D to an A+.
Designed and developed responsive websites with the Laravel MVC framework.
Integrated feeds from Twitter, the University Calendar and the Career Center Blog.

work.summary: The ACLU is our nation's guardian of liberty, working daily in courts, legislatures and communities to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties.
highlights: Designed, developed and published a WordPress-based website.

work.summary: The Auburn University O!ce of Information Technology provides centralized computing services and resources to the Auburn University community.
highlights: Created a science education website providing resources to twelve universities and every high school in Alabama.
Designed the main university portal accessed by 24,000 students and faculty members.
Refreshed the primary Auburn University site-wide template.

courses: COMP 4970 - Introduction To Game Design and Development
